text: Sabrina Annlynn Carpenter (born May 11, 1999), nicknamed Ms. Sabrina, is an American singer, songwriter, actress, and record producer. She was born and raised in Quakertown, Pennsylvania, about an hour from Philadelphia; her parents are David and Elizabeth (a chiropractor). She has three older sisters. ==Career== After moving to Los Angeles at 13, Carpenter acted as Maya Hart, the best friend of Riley Matthews (portrayed by Rowan Blanchard) in the Disney Channel series Girl Meets World. Girl Meets World was let out on . She was signed to Hollywood Records before moving to Island Records. Sabrina Carpenter got more success in 2024 with the singles "Espresso" and "Please Please Please", from her fifth studio album, Short n' Sweet. "Espresso" became her first UK number-one hit and reached the top three in the US and Canada. "Please Please Please" became her first US and Canadian number-one song and second UK number-one. The third single from the album, "Taste", debuted at number two on the Hot 100 and topped the UK chart. It became both her third UK number-one and third US pop radio airplay number-one. The album entered at number one on the US Billboard 200 album chart, selling 362,000 copies there in its first week. In April 2024, Sabrina Carpenter released the single "Espresso". The next day, she performed at Coachella. "Espresso" was in the Billboard Global 200. Espresso was at number three on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. It went on to win the MTV Video Music Award for Song of the Year. Sabrina Carpenter followed with a second single, "Please Please Please" on June 6, 2024, which became Sabrina Carpenter's second global chart-topper and her first US Hot 100 number one single. With these songs, she became the first female artist to hold the number one and two positions on the UK singles chart for three weeks in a row. Carpenter became haircare brand Redken's first global ambassador. She also partnered with American coffee and donut chain Dunkin' for an exclusive coffee drink, the Brown Sugar Shakin' Espresso. Since 2024, she also serves as a record producer for herself and other artists under the pseudonym Rafael Goldstein. ==Discography== * Eyes Wide Open (2015) * Evolution (2016) * Singular: Act I (2018) * Singular: Act II (2019) * Emails I Can't Send (2022) * Short n' Sweet (2024) ==Tours== Headlining * Evolution Tour (2016–2017)Kuchik, Natalie (September 6, 2016).
